statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Charlotte 80, Yale 74
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. (AP) -- Leemire Goldwire scored a career high 22 points, including two key free throws in the final 30 seconds, to help Charlotte beat Yale 80-74 in the first round of the Cable Car Classic on Tuesday night. Martin Iti added a career high 18 points and 10 rebounds for his third career double-double as the 49ers (8-2) won their fifth straight and seven in eight. Curtis Withers and Eddie Basden each had 16. Dominick Martin scored 21 points to lead Yale (2-7), which lost its fourth straight and sixth in seven games. Edwin Draughton added 20 points and Alex Gamboa had 16. The 49ers are making their fourth appearance in the event, and their first since winning the 1993 Classic over a Santa Clara team that featured current NBA star Steve Nash. Charlotte will meet Central Connecticut State in Wednesday's championship game. The Blue Devils beat host Santa Clara 80-68 in an earlier first-round contest. While Charlotte led most of the way, the Bulldogs managed to make it interesting. Draughan made consecutive layups to bring Yale within 68-65 with five minutes left. Yale eventually closed to within two before Withers sank a 3-pointer from the top of the key with 2:01 remaining to give Charlotte some breathing room. Goldwire raced down court in the final minute with a chance to put the 49ers up by seven but Draughan blocked his layup, which led to Gamboa's 3-pointer with 35 seconds left that cut Charlotte's lead to 76-74. Goldwire then sank a pair of free throws to extend the 49ers' lead. Goldwire was 4-of-5 from 3-point range early, leading the 49ers to a 39-31 halftime lead. Charlotte was 10-for-19 for the game from 3-point range.
